result.execSummary:
The defendant Demian Thomas Decorah was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Verdict forms, 1 signed - guilty as to Ct. 1; 1 signed - guilty as to Ct. 2;  2 unsigned as to not guilty verdicts on Cts. 1 & 2
Exhibit #5 marked by Atty Long at the 10/11/18 Jury Trial, Lab Report by Analyst Kenneth Olson, moved and received

9:33 Court in session, 35 jurors called, 4 excused, 1 no show. 30 potential jurors available; sworn.  23 jurors seated w/voir dire by the Court - questions submitted by prosecution and defense; 13 jurors selected and sworn. Court in recess 10:11/10:30 Court resumed; individual voir dire with juror #11;  juror #11 excused. Trial to proceed with 12 jurors 10:35

2:15pm - Defendant, Demian Thomas Decorah, appeared. ADA Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court sentenced defendant:  Ct. 1 - 30 days jail w/huber, jail start date 11/2/08 at 7:00pm, $1,630.50 fine/costs, due in 60 days or payment plan; and Ct. 2 - 10 days jail w/huber, consecutive, $673.50 fine/costs, due in 60 days or payment plan, DNA Sample.  2:38pm

8:45 State appeared by Atty Long w/Deputy Matthew Menard designated as court officer.  Defendant appeared in person, pro se.  Court reviewed defendant's right to counsel, defendant would like to proceed with jury trial, pro se.  Court reviewed jury trial procedure.  Court in recess. 9:15/9:33 Court resumed, appearances the same, potential jurors present and sworn, voir dire by the Court, peremptory strikes, 13 jurors sworn.  Court in recess 10:11/10:33 Court resumed, appearances the same, individual voir dire of 1 juror, juror excused. Trial will proceed with 12 jurors. Jury returned. Court read jury instructions to juror, jury excused @ 10:55.  ADA Long addressed previous convictions, Court stated jury will not be made aware of severity of this crime. 11:02 Jury returned.  Atty Long gave opening statement.  11:05 Defendant declined giving opening statement.  State called Sergeant Matthew Menard, Columbia County Sheriff's Office, sworn  Direct exam by Atty Long; Exhibits #1 - 4 marked by Atty Long; Exhibits #1 - 4 moved and received into evidence.  11:21 Cross exam by defendant; witness excused.  11:24 State called Detective Sergeant Alexander Agnew, Columbia County Sheriff's Office, sworn.  Direct exam by Atty Long.  11:30 Cross exam by defendant, witness excused.  11:33 State called Analyst Kenneth Olson, retired from Wisconsin State Crime Lab.  Direct exam by Atty Long; Exhibit #5 marked by Atty Long.  11:39 Cross exam by defendant. witness excused.  11:40  Exhibit #5 moved and received;  State rested.  11:41 Jury excused.  Court advised defendant of  right to testify, defendant stated he will not testify, defense rested. Court in recess 11:45am/12:49pm  Court resumed; appearances the same; parties received jury instructions; Court allowed time for review.  Court in recess.  12:50/12:54 Court resumed, appearances the same.  Defendant stated he will not testify; Court and counsel reviewed jury instructions. 1:06 Jury returned.  Court read jury instructions to jurors. 1:19  Closing statement by Atty Long; closing statement by defendant; rebuttal by Atty Long.  1:25 Court read further instructions to jurors.  1:29  Bailiffs sworn; jury excused for deliberation; Court in recess at 1:30/1:37 Court resumed, appearances the same; jury returned.  Jury found the defendant guilty as to Ct. 1 and Ct. 2; jurors polled, jury excused.  1:42 State moved for Judgment on the felony, Atty Long filed certified JOC, Defendant accepted, Court will enter Judgment on Ct. 1 and Ct. 2.  Court in recess. 1:40/1:49 Court resumed, appearances the same.   ADA Long requested sentencing date, defendant requested to proceed with sentencing today.  Sentencing will be today; Court in recess. 1:50pm.  Note:  Sentencing began at 2:15 - see minutes under sentencing hearing
Jury trial on October 11, 2018 at 09:00 am.

10:02am/10:09am. Defendant, Demian Thomas Decorah, appeared. Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  New date will have to be set for jury trial.  Defendant will not be having an attorney.  Court will grant motion for a new trial date.  Dates given by Judge Cross 9/20/18, 9/27/18, 9/28/18, 10/8/18, 10/10/18 & 10/11/18.  Atty Long will check her calendar and let the court know by the end of the day.
Motion hearing on August 10, 2018 at 10:00 am.
for reset of trial due to witness not being available filed by ADA Long
Jury trial on October 4, 2018 at 09:00 am.

Defendant, Demian Thomas Decorah, appeared pro se. Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin, stated defendant, in the past, was getting attorney. Defendant stated he is representing himself. Judge inquired about defendant representing himself, stated penalties and elements the State needs to prove. Defendant addressed not receiving discovery. Judge Miller had ordered it be provided at the last pretrial. ADA Long stated Atty. Davis received discovery. ADA Long had nothing in her file regarding getting discovery to the defendant. Defendant stated Ltd. Matt Tye from Madison P.D. is his one witness. Court ordered ADA Long to provide discovery to the defendant. This week's jury trial will not go forward. Jury trial to be reset with Br. 3. Court accepted defendant's oral request for speedy trial. Jury trial to be set within 90 days.
Final pre-trial on July 16, 2018 at 09:15 am.
Filed by ADA Crystal Long
Filed by ADA Crystal Long
Pre-trial conference on June 6, 2018 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on July 19, 2018 at 09:00 am.

Defendant, Demian Thomas Decorah, appeared. Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State called witness.  Direct examination.  Exhibit #1 marked (copy of JOC).  Cross examination.  Exhibit #1 received.  Probable cause found.  Information to be filed in 24 hours.  Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.
standard felony conditions

Defendant, Demian Thomas Decorah, appeared. Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $2,000.00 sign bond, standard felony conditions, no time limit waiver,  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 18, 2014 at 09:00 am.
